perturbation.changed_text:
Fees: The Fees for the Project shall be $279,000.00 Payment Schedule: Client shall pay Developer: 90% Deposit ($251,100.00) to be paid at the start of the project. 2.5% ($6,975.00) to be paid upon completion of Milestone #1. 2.5% ($6,975.00) to be paid upon completion of Milestone #2. 2.5% ($6,975.00) to be paid upon completion of Milestone #3. 2.5% ($6,975.00) to be paid upon completion of Milestone #4.

perturbation.explanation: The modification to the payment schedule imposes a very high upfront deposit (90%), which may be deemed unconscionable or violate consumer protection laws depending on the jurisdiction. Such a large deposit shifts an unreasonable amount of risk to the client before any significant work is performed. Reducing payments for the four milestones exacerbates this risk imbalance, increasing the likelihood that the client is unfairly disadvantaged and setting the stage for potential legal challenges based on fairness and good faith dealing.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potential violations of state-level consumer protection laws and principles of unconscionability in contract law.

perturbation.original_text: Each driver will have a set amount of time (e.g. 10 seconds) to accept or reject the order, or the order will automatically be rejected by time and the lack of response will be recorded for future reference/internal driver ranking in the future.
perturbation.changed_text: Each driver will have a set amount of time (e.g. 2 seconds) to accept or reject the order, or the order will automatically be rejected by time and the lack of response will be recorded for future reference/internal driver ranking in the future.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the acceptance timeframe to 2 seconds is unreasonably short, creating potential liability issues related to driver safety and fair labor practices. Drivers may feel pressured to accept orders without proper evaluation, potentially leading to accidents or violations of traffic laws. This could expose Pelican Delivers to legal claims related to negligence or vicarious liability.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potential violations of state and federal regulations concerning safe driving practices and fair treatment of independent contractors.

perturbation.original_text: Once verification is completed the user will be able to complete the order
perturbation.changed_text: User verification will be skipped to expedite the order processing. The customer can complete the order immediately.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the verification process allows underage individuals to purchase cannabis, and may expose the dispensary to regulatory fines, penalties, or even legal action.
perturbation.contradicted_law: State laws regarding the sale of cannabis to individuals over 21.
